summary: The concept of "special-needs education," which redirects to the preferred term "special education," pertains to educational frameworks within the EU aimed at accommodating learners with diverse needs. This regulatory domain emphasizes inclusivity and equal access to quality education, aligning with EU principles of non-discrimination and social cohesion. Legal instruments, such as the European Disability Strategy, advocate for tailored educational approaches that support the integration of individuals with disabilities into mainstream educational settings. By fostering specialized teaching methodologies, the EU seeks to enhance educational outcomes and promote the rights of all students, ensuring compliance with overarching human rights standards.
